intro: Spiracantha denticulata, commonly known as the toothed spiraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a serrated or toothed margin, giving it its scientific name. Spiracantha denticulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
